subject: Re: [junit] JUnit testing for MIDP applications?
msgSnippet: ... The lack of reflection makes it hard for a true port. I ve seen a couple of JUnit-like test tools that just didn t motivate me enough to use them. We use
messageBody:
--- Brian Button <bbutton01@...> wrote:
> Has anyone ported junit to MIDP and J2ME yet? I'm working on an
> application, and I'd like to avoid reinventing the wheel if
> possible :)

The lack of reflection makes it hard for a true port. I've seen a
couple of JUnit-like test tools that just didn't motivate me enough to
use them. We use JUnit on a desktop for our unit tests and then verify
we can build with bootclasspath set for a MIDP environment. That covers
everything except the UI.

Regards,

Rob
